qas.question: What agreement called for the stop of Hostilities?
What did the Birao Peace Agreement call for?
What major group did not sign the peace agreement immediately?
When did the CPJP finally sign the peace agreement?
When was the Birao Peace Agreement signed?
When did the FDPC continue its activities but also sign a peace agreement?
What is one thing the UFDR agreement in February called for?
What is the name of the agreement that came before the FACA agreement in April 2007?
When the CPJP continued to fight, what did other groups do?
What is one thing the FACA peace agreement called for when signed in April 2007?

context: <b7_0>The <a0_0>Syrte Agreement<b7_0/><a0_0/> in February and the Birao Peace Agreement in <a4_0>April 2007<a4_0/> called for <b6_0>a cessation of hostilities<b6_0/>, the billeting of FDPC fighters and their integration with FACA, <a1_0>the <b9_0>liberation of political prisoners<b9_0/><a1_0/>, integration of FDPC into government, an amnesty for the UFDR, its recognition as a political party, and the integration of its fighters into the national army. Several groups continued to fight but other groups <b8_0>signed on to the agreement<b8_0/>, or similar agreements with the government (e.g. UFR on 15 December 2008). The only major group not to sign an agreement at the time was the <a2_0>CPJP<a2_0/>, which continued its activities and signed a peace agreement with the government on <a3_0><b5_0>25 August 2012<b5_0/><a3_0/>.
